meanings.definition: To postpone consideration of (a motion, bill, etc.) to a future time.
meanings.sent1: The committee tabled the decision on the new policy until next month.
meanings.sent2: The city council tabled the proposal for further review.
meanings.sent3: The idea of having a pizza party was tabled until after the big project was completed.
meanings.sent4: She tabled the discussion on vacation plans, hoping to focus on work first.
meanings.sent5: The teacher tabled the quiz until everyone was ready to take it.

meanings.definition: To present formally for discussion or consideration.
meanings.sent1: The student tabled his research findings to the class for feedback.
meanings.sent2: The CEO tabled the new business strategy at the board meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat tabled its toy mouse in front of its owner, seeking playtime.
meanings.sent4: The artist tabled her latest painting to the art gallery for exhibition.
meanings.sent5: The chef tabled the new menu options to the restaurant owner for approval.

meanings.definition: To enter in a list or table.
meanings.sent1: She tabled the names of the volunteers for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent2: The secretary tabled the meeting agenda for all attendees.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tabled its acorn collection in a neat row.
meanings.sent4: He tabled the financial data in the spreadsheet for analysis.
meanings.sent5: The librarian tabled the new book arrivals for cataloging.
